messages.content: Dear resident, In the early hours of June 24th last year, I was hit by the news that Britain had voted to leave the European Union. After many hard weeks of campaigning, I was exhausted and heartbroken. After a few hours of restless sleep, I decided to stand as the Liberal Democrat candidate for Putney, Southfields and Roehampton. To fight for a vision of Britain that is open, tolerant and compassionate.

I grew up in a military family, moving all over the UK. We didn’t have much but I feel incredibly fortunate. I was the first in my family to go to university and now work with charities on education, helping others to have those same opportunities.

Despite my nomadic upbringing, I have quickly come to call Southfields my home, because we are a diverse community of people from all over the world. No matter where you come from, everyone is welcome here.

So when the prime minister of our country said, “if you are a citizen of the world you are a citizen of nowhere”, she was talking about us. She was talking about our community here in Putney. I don’t know about you, but I take that personally.

Now we have a general election, called so the Conservative party can sweep away all opposition, to implement their vision of an extreme hard Brexit with no one to hold them to account. This election is our chance to change the direction of our country.

Whether it be fighting for our place in the Single Market, opposing Conservative cuts to our local schools or providing opposition to Theresa May’s inevitable majority, I promise to hold her to account, fighting for the best deal for Putney and the country. Help me to fight against this Brexit government, to change Britain’s future. Vote Liberal Democrat.
PS Remember - This election is our chance to change the direction of our country and say no to damaging hard Brexit and cuts to our local schools.
